summary:
The US and Iran held a third round of indirect nuclear talks in Geneva. President Trump deployed warships and aircraft to the Middle East during the discussions. No deal emerged, with prospects remaining unclear. This affects global energy markets through the Strait of Hormuz and regional stability in the Persian Gulf.

NATO launched its first coordinated response after a second Baltic Sea cable was severed, following a suspected sabotage incident the previous day. The alliance aims to protect undersea links carrying Europe's energy and data. Separately in Sudan, a UN fact-finding mission reported that the Rapid Support Forces' 18-month siege of El Fasher in North Darfur targets Zaghawa and Fur communities for destruction, affecting 500,000 residents. The mission calls for intervention. In Congo, Rwanda-backed M23 rebels overran troops to enter Goma, a city sheltering 1 million displaced persons amid shelling. The UN warns of an aid crisis as the Congolese army retreats.

China's Vanke reported massive financial losses amid its real estate crisis, impacting investors, homebuyers, and an economy worth trillions. Israel allowed hundreds of thousands of displaced Palestinians to return to northern Gaza on foot after a hostage release agreement, easing a humanitarian crisis amid ruins. In Mexico, Sinaloa Cartel faction fighting turned Culiacán into a war zone, displacing thousands as government forces deployed. SpaceX launched Crew-10 from Kennedy Space Center with two NASA astronauts, Japan's Takuya Onishi, and Russia's Kirill Peskov to retrieve Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams after nine months on the ISS.

headlines.title: US and Iran Hold Third Round of Indirect Talks in Geneva Amid Warship Deployment
headlines.summary: President Trump deploys warships and aircraft to the Middle East as the US and Iran conduct third indirect nuclear talks in Geneva. Tensions rise with unclear deal prospects, risking escalation. This affects global energy markets and regional stability.

framings.angle: Live coverage of third round indirect talks in Geneva with Trump military deployment
Discusses talks as last-ditch nuclear deal effort amid building pressure
Liveblog of nuclear talks starting amid massive US military build-up

headlines.title: UN Mission Finds RSF Siege of Sudan's El Fasher Bears Hallmarks of Genocide
headlines.summary: UN fact-finding mission details 18-month RSF occupation of North Darfur capital, targeting Zaghawa and Fur communities for destruction. Affects 500,000 residents; calls for intervention. Signals worsening ethnic violence in Sudan.

headlines.title: SpaceX Launches Four Astronauts to Retrieve NASA Crew Stuck Nine Months on ISS
headlines.summary: Crew-10, including two NASA astronauts, Japan's Takuya Onishi and Russia's Kirill Peskov, blasts off from Kennedy Space Center. Enables return of Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams. Routine rotation restores ISS operations.

headlines.title: China's Vanke Reports Huge Losses Signaling Spread of Property Crisis
headlines.summary: Leading developer Vanke posts massive financial losses amid deepening real estate woes. Raises bailout questions for state intervention. Impacts investors, homebuyers and China's economy worth trillions.

headlines.title: Dr. Peter Attia Resigns CBS News Post After Emails Appear in Epstein Files
headlines.summary: Medical podcaster and author resigns following Justice Department release naming him in Epstein documents. Affects CBS credibility and Attia's longevity brand. Prompts scrutiny of Epstein connections.

headlines.title: US House Rejects Bill Requiring Aircraft Locators Near Busy Airports
headlines.summary: House votes down measure post last year's fatal midair collision near Reagan National killing dozens. Impacts aviation safety for 100 million annual passengers. Next push likely in Senate.

headlines.title: US Announces Consular Services in West Bank Settlement for First Time
headlines.summary: State Department to provide embassy services in Israeli settlement, drawing criticism as settlement legitimization. Affects Palestinians and US-Israel ties. Sparks diplomatic backlash worldwide.

headlines.title: BBC Reveals Nepal Police Order Caused Shooting Deaths of 19 Youth Protesters
headlines.summary: Investigation uncovers police directive led to killing 19 Gen Z demonstrators in school uniforms during Kathmandu protests last September. Affects youth rights; prompts accountability calls.

headlines.title: Sinaloa Cartel Rivals Turn Mexico's Culiacán into War Zone with Intense Fighting
headlines.summary: Faction feud surges violence in northern city, instilling widespread fear among residents. Thousands flee; government deploys forces. Threatens regional stability and drug trade routes.

headlines.title: Israel Allows Palestinians to Stream Back to Northern Gaza After Hostage Deadlock Breaks
headlines.summary: Displaced Gazans cross military zone on foot following hostage release agreement. Affects hundreds of thousands returning amid ruins. Eases humanitarian crisis but risks renewed conflict.
headlines.previousContext: Israel permits crossing military zone after breaking deadlock over hostage releases

headlines.title: Rwanda-Backed Rebels Enter Congo's Goma Overrunning Troops Amid Shelling
headlines.summary: M23 fighters advance into city sheltering 1 million displaced, sparking gunfire. UN warns aid crisis; Congolese army retreats. Escalates regional war displacing millions.
headlines.previousContext: Rebels overrun troops and enter Goma with gunfire, shelling; 1 million displaced inside city

headlines.title: NATO Launches First Coordinated Response After Second Baltic Sea Cable Severed
headlines.summary: Alliance acts on suspected sabotage campaign targeting infrastructure. Protects undersea links vital for Europe energy, data. Heightens hybrid threat concerns from Russia.
headlines.previousContext: Another deep-sea cable severed in suspected sabotage prompting NATO action
